column1: JAWS Default runtime configuration file Copyright 1995-2014 Freedom Scientific Inc.

column5: Definition
If off, order is dlg info|group info|focus info, If on, order is focus info|group info|dialog info
flags used by Structured Mode internal code to determine which components to include on the display
delimited list of preferred Braille tables which will be cycled through when the BrailleCyclePreferredTranslationTable script is invoked.
0 force DOM, 1 legacy use DOM except in edits, 2 hybrid, 3 always use OSM.
Whether or not panning buttons are reversed.
Allow contracted Braille to be entered on the display's keyboard and have it automatically backtranslated into tyor application.
0 off, distinguish each bullet type, 1 treat all bullets the same
allow words to break at dash, at symbol, slash and backslash, improves display usage when viewing paths and web/email addresses
Sets Braille verbosity for Flash messages, 0 beginner, 1 intermediate, 2 advanced
When Grade 2 is on, whether or not to show capital indicators
Whether or not to show Flash Messages
If a display has no Status Cells, whether or not to prepend the Message Prefix to the Flash Message
when a Flash message is sent to the display via a script, how long it should be shown for if not specified by the script. measured in milliseconds
The text to show in the status area of the display when a Flash message is being shown if the display has no status cells, the text will be prepended to the Flash message
Dot Firmness
Where should status cells be displayed if the display supports custom layout
how many cells to use for status information if the display defines none of its own

AutoPan Algorithm 0=off, 1=move display minimally to include whole word containing cursor, 2=MatchUserPan, 3=move display to show whole word at cursor nearest the middle of the display area, 4=maximize text after cursor, 5=maximize text before cursor, 6=autopan to default structured segment 255=Smart Autopan, autopan using the best algorithm for the current situation
Whether or not to allow words to be split in order to maximize the use of the Braille display. Ignored if panning is set to fixed increment
Whether or not to filter certain control characters (currently newlines, linefeeds and tabs)
When in Attribute Mode and characters have multiple attributes, determines how long each attribute should be shown for. This value is in Milliseconds.

0=Best Fit Panning (don't break words) 1=use fixed increment when panning 2=maximize text on display (like best fit but allow overlap of previously shown text to maximize context information) 3=pan by structured segment or component (such as name, value, type, etc) 255=Smart User Pannning, ie choose best algorithm for situation
1=pressing a keystroke in the Braille display will interrupt speech 0=it won't
1 grade 2 Braille translation on, 0 off
1 expand current word, 0 translate the whole line. Only relevant when grade 2 translation is on.
Line=0, Structured=1, Speech Output=2, Attribute Indicators=3
When the Braille cursor moves: 0 don't move the active cursor, 1 move the active cursor along with the Braille cursor

1=automatically route the Braille display to the active cursor whenever the active cursor moves or a key on the keyboard is pressed 0=never automatically route the Braille display to the active cursor
eight dot braille mode 0=six dots mode, 1 = eight dots mode
Set to 1 for the cursor to be shown as all dots raised, 0 to show it using dots seven and eight only
Speed, in milliseconds, at which the cursor on the Braille display should blink
Name of Braille Translation table. should be name of a .JBT file in the JFW root directory, devoid of the JBT extension
Mode setting for braille translation. If your braille translator supports mode settings then set it with this parameter:

Show Marking may be any combination of the following ored together brlMarkNothing= 0, brlMarkText = 1, brlMarkBold = 2, brlMarkItalic = 4, brlMarkUnderline = 8, brlMarkStrikeout = 16, brlMarkGraphic = 32, brlMarkHighlight = 64, brlMarkColor= 128, // see brlOptColorsToMark string option brlMarkExtended=256, // things like spelling and grammatical errors in MSWord etc, script defined marking brlMarkDoubleStrikeout=512, brlMarkSuperscript=1024, brlMarkSubscript=2048, brlMarkShadow=4096, brlMarkOutline=8192, brlMarkEmboss=16384, brlMarkEngrave=32768, Note when Extended marking is on, JAWS calls the PointNeedsMarking function passing in the coordinates of each cell to determine whether text at that location requires marking. This is useful when the attribute you want to mark is not actually known to JAWS such as the red and green zigzags in MSWord indicating spelling or grammatical errors.

Note the BrailleMarkColors settings only has an effect if the BrailleMarking option includes marking colors, ie is set to at least 32. set the BrailleMarkColors to a string defining each set of text/background colors to mark. To ignore a color, use *. for example, to mark red on anything use 255000000/*. You may define up to 9 sets of colors. Separate each set with a comma. A valid string would look like the following: mark red on anything or blue on white. use the string 255000000/*,000000255/255255255
Set to 1 to turn off Braille driver, typically used to disable Braille for a specific application
the following is useful when providing field prompts and text in Braille with rich edits 1 is on, 0 is off
0 off, distinguish each bullet type, 1 treat all bullets the same
allow words to break at dash, at symbol, slash and backslash, improves display usage when viewing paths and web/email addresses
Sets Braille verbosity for Flash messages 0 beginner, 1 intermediate, 2 advanced
When Grade 2 is on, whether or not to show capital indicators
Whether or not to show Flash Messages

Set to 1 to turn off Braille driver, typically used to disable Braille for a specific application
Set to one causes JFW to track the menu bar in Office applications
Set to one causes MAGic to track the focus rectangle in standard controls that utilize focus rectangles.
set to 1 if line segments should be included in the Off Screen Model This is required for Excel and other programs which draw a focus rectangle
number of milliseconds for JFW to wait before speaking newly written text. Setting this to a non-zero value, may cause terminal programs to respond in a less choppy fashion
set to 1 to Cause JFW to disallow Windows calling the SetSysModalWindow function. In most cases this is desirable, because System Modal Windows cannot be spoken
Allows JFW to speak System Modal Message Boxes 0=off, 1 = on
minimum height of a line that can be treated as a vertical caret
maximum height of a line that can be treated as a vertical caret
minimum width of a line that can be treated as a vertical caret
maximum width of a line that can be treated as a vertical caret
minimum height of a line that can be treated as a horizontal caret
maximum height of a line that can be treated as a horizontal caret
minimum width of a line that can be treated as a horizontal caret
maximum width of a line that can be treated as a horizontal caret
milliseconds after which the last draw of the caret becomes invalidated
number of pixels to the right of the current JAWS cursor at which a mouse click should be simulated
number of pixels below the current JAWS cursor at which a mouse click should be simulated

If set to 0, an edit prompt will only be found if it immediately precedes the edit field in tab order. When set to 1, more prompts will be foun, but each prompt must be in its own window and that window must be a sibling window of the edit control. When set to 2, the prompt will also be found if it is in the window of the edit control. When set to 3, the prompt will also be found if it is in the grandparent window of the edit control.
how far away in pixels can an underline be before being considered an actual underline
when simulating spaces in blank portions of a line, number of pixels represented by each space
how many pixels (high) per blank line

When there is blank space between the left of the client area and the first character on a line, the Left Margin setting defines how many pixels to ignore. If the Left Margin setting is greater than the amount of blank it will be reduced so that no text is clipped. Optimized for DOS apps. LeftMargin=5
Minimum width of a graphic
Maximum width of a graphic
Minimum height of a graphic
Maximum height of a graphic
Which graphics to speak 0 means ignore all graphics 1 means speak labeled graphics only 2 means speak all graphics
0=Store graphic CRC values when the graphics are bein drawn to the screen ; 1=compute them from the screen image at the time they are requested to be spoken
used to trim the size of a braille graphic Useful to preserve the virtical positioning of braille text

Whether or not to speak ANSI characters above 126 as "ANSI XXX". 0=never speak these characters as "ANSI XXX" 1=Speak them in TypeingEcho, SayCharacter and SpellWord 2=Also Speak them in SayWord 3=Also speak them in SayLine 4=Also speak them in SayAll Dictionary rules for specific characters are not impacted by this setting. The rules are always processed.

Used in some terminal emulation packages. When true, we mathematically calculate the location of spaces. This feature should be used cautiously in application specific files. Misuse can cause characters to disappear in text windows under certain circumstances.
Visual Basic Classes
IEServer Windows
End of IEServer windows
checkfree
Microsoft Works
AOLW Window Classes
maybe better as "button"
rompts for e-mail, etc.
e-mail list
Java classes
Windows Installer classes
Commented
Commented
whether or not to indicate (via a beep) when skimming over text units for which the regular expression returns FALSE. 0 off, 1 on (beep every 20 units skimmed over

0 off, 1 indicate when typing and the editor or wordprocessor wraps to a new line, 2 indicate when arrowing left/right or using left/right with modifiers. 4 indicate when reading text containing newline characters bitwise "or" the values together to indicate in multiple contexts eg a value of 3 will indicate when typing and also when arrowing. the method of indication is controlled by the Speech and Sounds scheme in use
0 don't announce ProgressBar updates, non-zero value specifies time in milliseconds which must elapse before the next update is announced
0 off, 1 non-ownerdrawn listboxes, 2 also check listboxes with LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE or LBS_OWNERDRAWFIXED window style.

this setting determines what happens when a virtual document loads for which a custom page summary has been defined 0 do nothing (a SayAll will be started as normal) 1 The summary will be spoken and focus left on the page at the place defined by the page 2 the summary will be presented in the virtual viewer for the user to immediately read. The user must press Escape to return to the actual document. Note this setting should generally be set from Personalized Web Settings
Whether or not to intercept CreateDIBSection Note that this value is only read once per JAWS session at startup thus changing this value while JAWS is running has no effect.
automatic Language detection, 1 on, 0 off

Whether to use information from the virtual HTML area for prompts in Forms mode Warning this will not always result in accurate information, particularly on pages where there are errors in the HTML coding which result in forms mode and virtual mode being out of synchronization
Currently this option is linked to the virtual cursor only 0 off, 1 on, 2 only on during SayAll
0 spell normal, 1 spell phonetic.
0 Off, 1 indicate caps when spelling or when navigating by character, 2 also indicate caps when reading by words 3 also indicate caps when reading by lines
During SayAll, indicate initial cap or capitalized word, 0 off, 1 on

determines how often an embedded ActiveX control causes the Virtual HTML area to be updated when receiving rapid ValueChange events from MSAA 0 means allow refresh rate to be dictated by MSAA a positive number means only refresh every X miliseconds -1 means don't refresh at all.

1=Jaws cursor is tethered to the Pc cursor, i.e., whenever the Pc cursor moves, the Jaws cursor will follow it. 0=Jaws cursor is indifferent to Pc cursor movements, which has been the traditional behavior
Sets the amount of text which SayAll sends to the synthesizer as a single unit. 0=line Use LinePauses = 1 or 0 for line with or without pause 1=Sentence 2= Paragraph
set to 1 to enable announcement of attributes etc in dialogs and menus if the scheme allows for it
Whether or not to indicate repeated characters, 1 on, 0 off
whether or not to indicate indentation
0=off, 1 = character, 2 = words, 3 = character and words
pressing a key that is not bound to macro will interrupt speech 0=off, 1 = on
0=off, 1 = on
Allows sticky keys to be used, ie ignores shift keys during SayAll. User can use left/right arrow to do same functions
1=during SayAll, left shift will skip back and right shift will skip forward 0=vice versa
0=off, 1= highlight, 2 = all
pressing a key that is bound to a macro will interrupt speech 0=off, 1 = on
pause at end of a line 0=off, 1 = on
process text through the dictionary 0=off, 1 on
0=off(handled by synth), 1 = digits, 2 = pairs, 3 = full numbers
Indicate case of spoken text with inflection change 0=off, 1 = on
filter repetitive characters after this many of them
words with embedded capital letters are spoken as separate words 0=off, 1 = on
how much speech to say beginner=0 (most speech), intermediate = 1, advanced = 2 (least speech)
if JAWS or the synthesizer controls the punctuation 0=synthesizer, 1 = JAWS
Say Window type before window title/text 0=off, 1 = on
say window state before title/text 0=off, 1 = on
operating mode of insert key 0=JAWS, 1= Sticky
how many cursor blinks are used to locate the caret
The number of milliseconds before JFW will give up looking for the caret
how fast the caret blinks, milliseconds on/off
Which insert keys can be used as a JAWS Insert 0=none 1=Numpad Insert 2=Extended Insert 3=both Numpad and Extended
Can be one of the types defined in default.jkm
Determines whether Extended and Numpad keys should be processed separately. 0=Treat Extended and Numpad keys the same 1=Differentiate between Extended and Numpad keys
synthesizer to use Available synthesizers are listed in JfW.INI

column4: "Audapter External with driver set to COM1:9600"
"Audapter External with driver set to COM2:9600"
"Braille 'n Speak and Type 'n Speak, set to COM1:9600"
"Braille 'n Speak and Type 'n Speak, set to COM2:9600"
"Doubletalk LT or LightTalk set to COM1:9600"
"Doubletalk LT or LightTalk set to COM2:9600"
"Doubletalk LT or LightTalk set to COM2:9600"

column5: Format is VIRTUAL-KEY-NAME=STATE|LABEL where VIRTUAL-KEY-NAME is the name of a virtual key as defined in the Microsoft winuser.h header file, devoide of the VK_ prefix STATE can be: 0=Don't Speak 1=Speak and LABEL is a user-defined label to be spoken when that key is pressed The first four special key codes are used to refer to groups of keys
for verbosity preferences Set overall speech level settings are as follows: 1=long messages 2=short messages

Set to 1, Traditional behaviour, edits and Richedits use OSM for reading Set to 0, we ask the control for information directly Setting to 0 in order to support Windows 7 / Vista OSM-less windows, such as the Licence Agreement. What was happening is you start the install, it installs relevant components but then you see no license agreement. The window is there, but it's blank to JAWS.
When asking the edit control directly, if the document is larger than this threshold we'll fall back to using the OSM since the control's response to our queries is too slow causing sluggishness.
0 off, 1 indicate annotations but don't read text of annotation, 2 indicate annotation and also read the annotation inline. No annotations necessary for simple text edits such as license agreement.
Whether or not to use legacy IE support or new FS Dom Server support
Whether or not Forms Mode is automatically turned off when the current page is updated 1 means turn forms mode off automatically (default), 0 means leave Forms Mode on
Whether or not to support embedded active x controls such as Macromedia Flash Movies set to 0 to ignore, 1 to support note only objects defined in JActiveX.ini are affected by this setting
0 don't indicate HTML attributes, 1 indicate any defined in the HTML Attributes Behavior map of the current scheme
0 favor label tag, 1 favor title attribute, 2 favor alt attribute, 3 favor longest, 4 use both label and title if different, 5 use both label and alt if different

When a graphical link contains no title or alt text for its enclosing image and the enclosing anchor has no title What should we render as a last resort? 0 for the image's src and 1 for its enclosing anchor's href
Whether or not to allow navigation keystrokes such as tab and shift tab to wrap to the top or bottom of the document
whether or not to expand abbreviations (using the abbr tag)
whether or not to expand acronyms (using the acronym tag)
Inline frames are often used for advertising 0 do not ignore inline frames, 1 ignore them

0 allow all refreshes, a positive number to ensure that refreshes don't occur before the value of milliseconds has elapsed. eg PageRefreshFilter=10000 will ensure that the page refreshes don't occur within 10 seconds of each other
0 don't indicate Block Quotations, 1 indicate them
0 Don't indicate lists, 1 indicate lists with the item count and nesting level
0 indicate all tables, 1 only indicate data tables
Next options used for configuring how data tables are detected This option specifies the minimum number of valid data rows that a table must contain in order for it to be considered a data table.
This option specifies the minimum number of cells that a row must contain in order for it to be considered a valid data row.
This option specifies the minimum number of rows which must contain text in order for the table to be considered a data table.
This option specifies the minimum number of columns which must contain text in order for the table to be considered a data table.
A cell is considered a valid data cell if it contains at least this number of characters
A cell is considered a valid data cell if it contains upto this number of characters
0 don't include HTML Element access keys, 1 include them
0 means to never include graphics 1 means to include graphics that have labels, i.e. alt=attributes 2 means to include all graphics
0 means favor title attribute, 1 favor alt attribute, 2 favor singly quoted string in OnMouseOver, 3 favor longest 4 use custom search
use vertical bar delimited list of attributes to search, eg title|alt|src
0 means to never include graphical links 1 means to include graphical links that have labels, i.e. alt=attributes 2 means to include all graphical links
0 means to never include image map links 1 means to include image map links that have labels, i.e. alt=attributes 2 means to include all image map links
1 means to identify the various types of links e.g. FTP link, SendMail Link, Graphic Link 0 means to just say "link" for all of these
1 means to identify links that point to other places on the current page by saying "Same Page Link"
The maximum number of characters which can appear on a line of a paragraph
The number of consecutive characters that must appear for JAWS to treat this as a block of text
How to indicate that a new frame has been encountered. 0=No indication 1=Say the title of the frame at the beginning and end of that frame 2=Say "New Frame" at the beginning of each frame
1 means that the screen will automatically scroll to display the line on which the VCursor is positioned
1 means that whenever a new page is displayed, position the VCursor on the first line which is different than the previous page
For Heading Indication, 0=off, 1=heading, 2=heading and level 3=play sound, 4=use voice alias, used in conjunction with controlType voice table entry for each heading control type
0 favor title, 1 favor screen text, 2 favor singly quoted string in onMouseOver, 3 favor longest, 4 use custom search string
use vertical bar delimited list of attributes to search, eg title|alt|href use special attribute value of screentext to use onscreen text
0=title, 1=screen text, 2=alt, 3=value, 4=longest, 5=custom
for verbosity preferences Set overall braille level settings are as follows: 1=long messages 2=short messages
